Unfortunately, due to the current circumstances with the pandemic, traditional face to face ceremonies throughout the Verde Valley have been cancelled and districts are coming up with alternative ways to celebrate both high school graduation and 8th grade promotion. We mailed a letter home to our 8th grade parents today about our alternative, which will be an 8th grade promotion parade. You can read this letter on our website at https://www.cjsd.k12.az.us/. We hope you understand the circumstances we are in and support us with this alternative. We feel it is the "next best thing" to honor our 8th graders and wish them well as they enter their HS careers. Thanks!

Pursuant to A.R.S. 41-1351 and the General Records Retention Schedule for School Districts and Charter Schools Student Records (#000-11-53) established by Arizona State Library, Archives and Public Records (L.A.P.R), Special Education Records (including placement records, referrals, evaluations, testing data and other related records) will be destroyed "four (4) years after fiscal year of final enrollment."

Clarkdale Jerome Elementary School will destroy all special education records that are older than five years as of 10/10/2019. Before these records are destroyed, parents and / or eligible students have the right to review the records and obtain copies of any information needed. To review / obtain these records, please call the district office at 634-5035 extension 343 prior to 11/19/2019. Destruction will take place on November 20th, 2019.

Save the Date! Please join us for the Fall Festival at the Verde Valley Fairgrounds on October 26th. All of our 4th graders made a piece of artwork (which were put together to create one awesome painting) for the Verde Valley Fall Festival. This is a fundraiser for the Verde Valley Fair. Here is how it works: All artworks will be offered for sale at the show. The base price for each is $5.00. If a student would like to purchase their work, their cost is $4.00. Should a student's work sell during the event for the base price, they will receive $1.00. Should it sell at a higher price, the student will receive their $1.00 plus 50% of the amount over $5.00. Thank You!

Erika Bergamini, Clarkdale-Jerome School Art Teacher

Dear Parents and Guardians,
Please see the following announcement:

Pursuant to A.R.S. §41-1351 and the General Records Retention Schedule for School Districts and Charter Schools Student Records (#000-11-53) established by Arizona State Library, Archives, and Public Records (L.A.P.R.), Special Education Records (including placement records, referrals, evaluations, testing data and other related records) will be destroyed “four (4) years after fiscal year of final enrollment.”

Clarkdale-Jerome Elementary School will destroy all Special Education records that are older than 5 years as of May 21, 2014. Before these records are destroyed, parents and / or eligible students have the right to review the records and obtain copies of any information needed. To review / obtain these records, please call the district office at 634-5035 extension 343 prior to May 21, 2019.Destruction will take place May 21, 2019.

Donations Requested:
As many of you know, we have our 7th grade overnight trip and 8th grade river trip coming up soon. We have several students who are in need of a sturdy, reliable pair of sport/water sandals for the trip such as Tevas, Chacos, or Keens (not flip flops). In recent years, we have seen the quality of generic sandals decline, therefore do not recommend these. If you have any gently used adult sizes of shoes of this type to donate for student use, please send them to school. We also have camping gear and high quality outdoor clothing to loan as needed. Additional donations welcome. Please send us a note if you have any questions. Jessica@cjsd.k12.az.us
